alert.note: Alert for Giles; Lawrence; Wayne (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 3:32AM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Wayne, southern Lawrence and southern Giles Counties through 430 AM CDT... At 332 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Collinwood, or 16 miles southeast of Waynesboro, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pulaski, Loretto, Ardmore, St. Joseph, Elkton, Minor Hill, Goodspring, Leoma, Westpoint, Iron City and Prospect. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 1 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Brief heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
